Detailed Description

A class to the log2 ratio data as used by the log2 ratio engine.

Definition at line 45 of file CNLog2RatioData.h.

Member Function Documentation

void CNLog2RatioData::calculateMedianSignal ( int  iProbeSetIndex,
int  iProbeSetsToProcess 
)

Calculate the median singal for the log2 ratio model.

The data is processed by probes set meaning the all the experiment data is processed for a subset of the probe sets. Note that the median signal is A + B.

Parameters:
int - The probe set index to start from.
int - The number of probe sets to process each time this function is called.

Definition at line 1824 of file CNLog2RatioData.cpp.

References Verbose::out(), and roundDouble().

Referenced by CNReferenceEngine::processData().

void CNLog2RatioData::calculateMedianSignalsPerGenotype ( int  iProbeSetIndex,
int  iProbeSetsToProcess 
)

Calculate the median singals for the log2 ratio model.

The data is processed by probes set meaning the all the experiment data is processed for a subset of the probe sets. Note that the median signals broken out by genotype is A - B.

Parameters:
int - The probe set index to start from.
int - The number of probe sets to process each time this function is called.

Definition at line 1846 of file CNLog2RatioData.cpp.

References Options::getOptInt(), Verbose::out(), and roundDouble().

Referenced by CNReferenceEngine::processData().

void CNLog2RatioData::calculateXYMedianSignal ( int  iProbeSetIndex,
int  iProbeSetsToProcess 
)

Calculate the median singals for the log2 ratio model.

The data is processed by probes set meaning the all the experiment data is processed for a subset of the probe sets. Note that the median signal is A + B. The hasXX and hasY is set in the calculateXY function.

Parameters:
int - The probe set index to start from.
int - The number of probe sets to process each time this function is called.

void CNLog2RatioData::writeCyto2ModelFile ( const AffxString &  strFileName  ) 

Write the model file in text format.

All the median signals asssociated with the probe sets are written out. Values are rounded to insure that the stored values will match the calculated values when using the same input.

Parameters:
const AffxString& - The file name to write to.
Returns:
bool - true if successful
